info.title: OPTIMADE API - Index meta-database
info.description:
The [Open Databases Integration for Materials Design (OPTIMADE) consortium](https://www.optimade.org/) aims to make materials databases interoperational by developing a common REST API.
This is the "special" index meta-database.

This specification is generated using [`optimade-python-tools`](https://github.com/Materials-Consortia/optimade-python-tools/tree/v0.3.3) v0.3.3.

schema.title: Response Get Info Index Optimade V1 Info Get

parameters.description:
See [the full and latest OPTIMADE spec](https://github.com/Materials-Consortia/OPTIMADE/blob/develop/optimade.rst) for filter query syntax.

Example: `chemical_formula = "Al" OR (prototype_formula = "AB" AND elements HAS Si, Al, O)`.

schema.title: Filter
schema.description:
See [the full and latest OPTIMADE spec](https://github.com/Materials-Consortia/OPTIMADE/blob/develop/optimade.rst) for filter query syntax.

Example: `chemical_formula = "Al" OR (prototype_formula = "AB" AND elements HAS Si, Al, O)`.

parameters.name: filter

schema.title: Response Get Links Index Optimade V1 Links Get

Attributes.title: Attributes
Attributes.description:
Members of the attributes object ("attributes") represent information about the resource object in which it's defined.
The keys for Attributes MUST NOT be:
    relationships
    links
    id
    type

AvailableApiVersion.title: AvailableApiVersion

url.title: Url
url.description: a string specifying a base URL that MUST adhere to the rules in section Base URL

version.title: Version
version.description: a string containing the full version number of the API served at that base URL. The version number string MUST NOT be prefixed by, e.g., 'v'.

AvailableApiVersion.description: A JSON object containing information about an available API version

BaseRealationshipMeta.title: BaseRealationshipMeta

description.title: Description
description.description: OPTIONAL human-readable description of the relationship

BaseRealationshipMeta.description: Specific meta field for base relationship resource

BaseRelationshipResource.title: BaseRelationshipResource

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Relationship meta field. MUST contain 'description' if supplied.

BaseRelationshipResource.description: Minimum requirements to represent a relationship resource

EntryRelationships.title: EntryRelationships

references.title: References
references.description: Object containing links to relationships with entries of the `references` type.

structures.title: Structures
structures.description: Object containing links to relationships with entries of the `structures` type.

EntryRelationships.description: This model wraps the JSON API Relationships to include type-specific top level keys.

EntryResource.title: EntryResource

id.title: Id
id.description:
An entry's ID as defined in section `Definition of Terms`_.
- **Type**: string.
- **Requirements/Conventions**:

  - **Response**: REQUIRED in the response unless explicitly excluded.
  - **Query**: MUST be a queryable property with support for all mandatory filter operators.
  - See section `Definition of Terms`_.

- **Examples**:

  - :val:`"db/1234567"`
  - :val:`"cod/2000000"`
  - :val:`"cod/2000000@1234567"`
  - :val:`"nomad/L1234567890"`
  - :val:`"42"`

type.title: Type
type.description:
The name of the type of an entry.
Any entry MUST be able to be fetched using the `base URL <Base URL_>`_ type and ID at the url :endpoint:`<base URL>/<type>/<id>`.
- **Type**: string.
- **Requirements/Conventions**:

  - **Response**: REQUIRED in the response unless explicitly excluded.
  - **Query**: Support for queries on this property is OPTIONAL.
    If supported, only a subset of string comparison operators MAY be supported.

- **Requirements/Conventions**: MUST be an existing entry type.
- **Example**: :val:`"structures"`

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing links related to the resource.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about a resource that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description:
a dictionary, containing key-value pairs representing the entry's properties, except for type and id.

Database-provider-specific properties need to include the database-provider-specific prefix
(see appendix `Database-Provider-Specific Namespace Prefixes`_).

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description:
a dictionary containing references to other entries according to the description in section `Relationships`_
encoded as `JSON API Relationships <https://jsonapi.org/format/1.0/#document-resource-object-relationships>`__.
The OPTIONAL human-readable description of the relationship MAY be provided in the :field:`description` field inside the :field:`meta` dictionary.

EntryResource.description: Resource objects appear in a JSON:API document to represent resources.

EntryResourceAttributes.title: EntryResourceAttributes

immutable_id.title: Immutable Id
immutable_id.description:
The entry's immutable ID (e.g., an UUID).
This is important for databases having preferred IDs that point to "the latest version" of a record, but still offer access to older variants.
This ID maps to the version-specific record, in case it changes in the future.
- **Type**: string.
- **Requirements/Conventions**:

  - **Response**: OPTIONAL in the response.
  - **Query**: If present, MUST be a queryable property with support for all mandatory filter operators.

- **Examples**:

  - :val:`"8bd3e750-b477-41a0-9b11-3a799f21b44f"`
  - :val:`"fjeiwoj,54;@=%<>#32"` (Strings that are not URL-safe are allowed.)

last_modified.title: Last Modified
last_modified.description:
Date and time representing when the entry was last modified.
- **Type**: timestamp.
- **Requirements/Conventions**:

  - **Response**: REQUIRED in the response unless explicitly excluded.
  - **Query**: MUST be a queryable property with support for all mandatory filter operators.

- **Example**:

  - As part of JSON response format: :VAL:`"2007-04-05T14:30Z"`
    (i.e., encoded as an `RFC 3339 Internet Date/Time Format <https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6>`__ string.)

EntryResourceAttributes.description: Contains key-value pairs representing the entry's properties.

ErrorLinks.title: ErrorLinks

about.title: About
about.description: A link that leads to further details about this particular occurrence of the problem.

ErrorLinks.description: A Links object specific to Error objects

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse

included.title: Included
included.description: A list of resources that are included

links.title: Links
links.description: Links associated with the primary data

jsonapi.title: Jsonapi
jsonapi.description: Information about the JSON API used

ErrorResponse.description: errors MUST be present and data MUST be skipped

ErrorSource.title: ErrorSource

pointer.title: Pointer
pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

parameter.title: Parameter
parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

ErrorSource.description: an object containing references to the source of the error

version.title: Version
version.description: version string of the current implementation

source_url.title: Source Url
source_url.description: URL of the implementation source, either downloadable archive or version control system

maintainer.title: Maintainer
maintainer.description: A dictionary providing details about the maintainer of the implementation.

ImplementationMaintainer.title: ImplementationMaintainer
ImplementationMaintainer.description: Details about the maintainer of the implementation

IndexInfoAttributes.title: IndexInfoAttributes

api_version.title: Api Version
api_version.description: Presently used version of the OPTIMADE API

available_api_versions.title: Available Api Versions
available_api_versions.description: A list of dictionaries of available API versions at other base URLs

available_endpoints.title: Available Endpoints
available_endpoints.description: List of available endpoints (i.e., the string to be appended to the base URL).

entry_types_by_format.title: Entry Types By Format
entry_types_by_format.description: Available entry endpoints as a function of output formats.

is_index.title: Is Index
is_index.description: If true, this is an index meta-database base URL (see section Index Meta-Database). If this member is not provided, the client MUST assume this is not an index meta-database base URL (i.e., the default is for is_index to be false).

IndexInfoAttributes.description: Attributes for Base URL Info endpoint for an Index Meta-Database

IndexInfoResource.title: IndexInfoResource

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing links related to the resource.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about a resource that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description: Reference to the child identifier object under the links endpoint that the provider has chosen as their 'default' OPTIMADE API database. A client SHOULD present this database as the first choice when an end-user chooses this provider.

IndexInfoResource.description: Index Meta-Database Base URL Info enpoint resource

included.title: Included
included.description: A list of resources that are included

links.title: Links
links.description: Links associated with the primary data

jsonapi.title: Jsonapi
jsonapi.description: Information about the JSON API used

data.title: Data
data.description: JSON API resource linkage. It MUST be either null or contain a single child identifier object with the fields 'id' and 'type'

JsonApi.title: JsonApi

version.title: Version
version.description: Version of the json API used

JsonApi.description: An object describing the server's implementation

Link.title: Link

href.title: Href
href.description: a string containing the link’s URL.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the link.

Link.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

id.title: Id
id.description:
An entry's ID as defined in section `Definition of Terms`_.
- **Type**: string.
- **Requirements/Conventions**:

  - **Response**: REQUIRED in the response unless explicitly excluded.
  - **Query**: MUST be a queryable property with support for all mandatory filter operators.
  - See section `Definition of Terms`_.

- **Examples**:

  - :val:`"db/1234567"`
  - :val:`"cod/2000000"`
  - :val:`"cod/2000000@1234567"`
  - :val:`"nomad/L1234567890"`
  - :val:`"42"`

type.title: Type
type.description: MUST be either "parent", "child", or "provider". These objects are described in detail in sections Parent and Child Objects and Provider Objects.

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing links related to the resource.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about a resource that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: a dictionary containing key-value pairs representing the entry's properties.

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description:
a dictionary containing references to other entries according to the description in section `Relationships`_
encoded as `JSON API Relationships <https://jsonapi.org/format/1.0/#document-resource-object-relationships>`__.
The OPTIONAL human-readable description of the relationship MAY be provided in the :field:`description` field inside the :field:`meta` dictionary.

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable name for the OPTIMADE API implementation a client may provide in a list to an end-user.

description.title: Description
description.description: Human-readable description for the OPTIMADE API implementation a client may provide in a list to an end-user.

base_url.title: Base Url
base_url.description: JSON API links object, pointing to the base URL for this implementation

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: JSON API links object, pointing to a homepage URL for this implementation

links.title: Links
links.description: Links associated with the primary data

jsonapi.title: Jsonapi
jsonapi.description: Information about the JSON API used

Meta.title: Meta
Meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

Provider.title: Provider

name.title: Name
name.description: a short name for the database provider

description.title: Description
description.description: a longer description of the database provider

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: database-provider-specific prefix as found in Appendix 1.

homepage.title: Homepage
homepage.description: a [JSON API links object](http://jsonapi.org/format/1.0#document-links) pointing to homepage of the database provider, either directly as a string, or as a link object.

index_base_url.title: Index Base Url
index_base_url.description: a [JSON API links object](http://jsonapi.org/format/1.0#document-links) pointing to the base URL for the `index` meta-database as specified in Appendix 1, either directly as a string, or as a link object.

Provider.description: Information on the database provider of the implementation.

ReferenceRelationship.title: ReferenceRelationship

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing at least one of the following: self, related

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object that contains non-standard meta-information about the relationship.

ReferenceRelationship.description: Similar to normal JSON API relationship, but with addition of OPTIONAL meta field for a resource

RelatedChildResource.title: RelatedChildResource
RelatedChildResource.description: Keep only type and id of a ChildResource

RelationshipLinks.title: RelationshipLinks
RelationshipLinks.description:
A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships").
Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

Relationships.title: Relationships
Relationships.description:
Members of the relationships object ("relationships") represent references from the resource object in which it's defined to other resource objects.
Keys MUST NOT be:
    type
    id

Resource.title: Resource

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing links related to the resource.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about a resource that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: an attributes object representing some of the resource’s data.

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description: a relationships object describing relationships between the resource and other JSON:API resources.

Resource.description: Resource objects appear in a JSON:API document to represent resources.

self.title: Self
self.description: A link that identifies the resource represented by the resource object.

ResponseMeta.title: ResponseMeta

query.title: Query
query.description: information on the query that was requested

api_version.title: Api Version
api_version.description: a string containing the version of the API implementation, e.g. v0.9.5

time_stamp.title: Time Stamp
time_stamp.description: a string containing the date and time at which the query was exexcuted

data_returned.title: Data Returned
data_returned.description: an integer containing the number of data objects returned for the query.

more_data_available.title: More Data Available
more_data_available.description: `false` if all data has been returned, and `true` if not.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: information on the database provider of the implementation.

data_available.title: Data Available
data_available.description: an integer containing the total number of data objects available in the database

last_id.title: Last Id
last_id.description: a string containing the last ID returned

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.description: a dictionary describing the server implementation

warnings.title: Warnings
warnings.description: List of warning resource objects representing non-critical errors or warnings. A warning resource object is defined similarly to a JSON API error object, but MUST also include the field type, which MUST have the value "warning". The field detail MUST be present and SHOULD contain a non-critical message, e.g., reporting unrecognized search attributes or deprecated features. The field status, representing a HTTP response status code, MUST NOT be present for a warning resource object. This is an exclusive field for error resource objects.

ResponseMeta.description:
A [JSON API meta member](https://jsonapi.org/format/1.0#document-meta)
that contains JSON API meta objects of non-standard
meta-information.

OPTIONAL additional information global to the query that is not
specified in this document, MUST start with a
database-provider-specific prefix.

ResponseMetaQuery.title: ResponseMetaQuery

representation.title: Representation
representation.description: a string with the part of the URL that follows the base URL. Example: '/structures?'

ResponseMetaQuery.description: Information on the query that was requested.

StructureRelationship.title: StructureRelationship

links.title: Links
links.description: a links object containing at least one of the following: self, related

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object that contains non-standard meta-information about the relationship.

StructureRelationship.description: Similar to normal JSON API relationship, but with addition of OPTIONAL meta field for a resource

ToplevelLinks.title: ToplevelLinks
ToplevelLinks.description: A set of Links objects, possibly including pagination

Warnings.title: Warnings

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

status.title: Status
status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

code.title: Code
code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.title: Source
source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

Warnings.description:
OPTIMADE-specific warning class based on OPTIMADE-specific JSON API Error.
From the specification:

    A warning resource object is defined similarly to a JSON API
    error object, but MUST also include the field type, which MUST
    have the value "warning". The field detail MUST be present and
    SHOULD contain a non-critical message, e.g., reporting
    unrecognized search attributes or deprecated features.

Note: Must be named "Warnings", since "Warning" is a built-in Python class.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.title: Source
source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error
